p: Due to the rapid growth of the human population that has led to an augmented need for food, it is necessary for the agricultural industry to modify methods that combat this problem. The necessity of prevention and control of plant diseases, as well as pests, is a key issue in crop protection. To date, the most commonly used strategy to combat these problems is the use of conventional pesticides, most of which are synthetic, including insecticides [ 33, 34, 35]. The intensified use of artificial pesticides leads to harmful effects on the environment, including the decrease in biodiversity and the rise in factors potentially hazardous for human health [ 36, 37]. Thus, less harmful strategies, for instance, the use of pesticides from natural origins, must be taken into consideration.
